alert.note: Alert for Lewis and Clark (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 15 at 3:24PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Montana, including the following county, Lewis and Clark. This flood advisory mainly affects rural areas south of Augusta and north of Highway 200. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 322 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. NWS radar estimates between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... areas around and near Bean Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
